Class LiveProcessingUseCase

java.lang.Object
ca.gc.cra.radar.application.pipeline.LiveProcessingUseCase
public final class LiveProcessingUseCase extends Object
Executes live packet capture and protocol reconstruction, persisting message pairs in real time.

The pipeline decouples capture from persistence via a bounded worker pool so back-pressure is handled gracefully. Instances are not reusable; invoke run() at most once.

Since:
RADAR 0.1-doc

  • Constructor Details

    • LiveProcessingUseCase

      public LiveProcessingUseCase(PacketSource packetSource, FrameDecoder frameDecoder, FlowAssembler flowAssembler, ProtocolDetector protocolDetector, Map<ProtocolId, Supplier<MessageReconstructor>> reconstructorFactories, Map<ProtocolId, Supplier<PairingEngine>> pairingFactories, PersistencePort persistence, MetricsPort metrics, Set<ProtocolId> enabledProtocols)
      Creates the live processing pipeline by wiring capture, flow assembly, and persistence ports.
      Parameters:
      packetSource - source of raw frames; must support PacketSource.start() and PacketSource.poll()
      frameDecoder - converts frames to TCP segments when possible
      flowAssembler - orders TCP bytes per flow
      protocolDetector - detects protocols for new flows
      reconstructorFactories - factories for protocol-specific byte-to-message handlers
      pairingFactories - factories that convert message events to MessagePairs
      persistence - sink for emitting message pairs immediately
      metrics - metrics sink updated for capture, decode, and pairing events
      enabledProtocols - subset of protocols to process; others are ignored
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

    • LiveProcessingUseCase

      public LiveProcessingUseCase(PacketSource packetSource, FrameDecoder frameDecoder, FlowAssembler flowAssembler, ProtocolDetector protocolDetector, Map<ProtocolId, Supplier<MessageReconstructor>> reconstructorFactories, Map<ProtocolId, Supplier<PairingEngine>> pairingFactories, PersistencePort persistence, MetricsPort metrics, Set<ProtocolId> enabledProtocols, int persistenceWorkers, int persistenceQueueCapacity)
      Creates the live processing pipeline with explicit persistence worker settings.
      Parameters:
      packetSource - source of raw frames
      frameDecoder - converts frames to TCP segments
      flowAssembler - orders TCP bytes per flow
      protocolDetector - detects protocols for new flows
      reconstructorFactories - factories for protocol-specific byte-to-message handlers
      pairingFactories - factories that convert message events to MessagePairs
      persistence - sink for emitting message pairs immediately
      metrics - metrics sink updated for capture, decode, and pairing events
      enabledProtocols - subset of protocols to process; others are ignored
      persistenceWorkers - number of worker threads handling persistence
      persistenceQueueCapacity - maximum buffered message pairs awaiting persistence
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run() throws Exception
      Runs the live loop until interrupted, persisting each reconstructed message pair via the worker pool.
      Throws:
      Exception - if any port fails during capture, decode, or persistence
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
